sen.j: 蚕ノ社駅（かいこのやしろえき）は、京都市右京区太秦森ヶ前町にある京福電気鉄道京福電気鉄道嵐山本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Uzumasa-morigamae-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kaikonoyashiro Station is a stop on the Arashiyama Main Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd..
Kaikonoyashiro Station, located in Uzumasa-morigamae-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Arashiyama Main Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Kaikonoyashiro Station, located in Uzumasa-morigamae-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Arashiyama Main Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
The station number is A7.
The station number is A7.
The station number is A7.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: プラットホーム分類2面2線を持つ地上駅。
sen.e: This station is located on the ground level, with two platforms serving two tracks between them.
This station is located on the ground level, with two platforms serving two tracks between them.
This station is located on the ground level, with two platforms serving two tracks between them.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 木嶋坐天照御魂神社（蚕ノ社）

sen.j: 京都府道112号二条停車場嵐山線
sen.e: The Nijoteishajo Arashiyama road of Kyoto Prefecture road 112
The Nijoteishajo Arashiyama road of Kyoto Prefectural Road 112
Kyoto Prefectural Route 112: Nijoteishajo-Arashiyama Line
sen.cmt: 道路表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）3月25日 嵐山電車軌道の駅として開業。
sen.e: March 25, 1910: This station started its operation as a station of Arashiyama Trams.
March 25, 1910: This station started its operation as a facility of Arashiyama Trams.
March 25, 1910: This station started its operation as a facility of Arashiyama Trams.

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）4月2日 会社合併により京都電燈の駅となる。
sen.e: April 2, 1918: The companies concerned merged and it became a station of the Kyoto Dento electric power company.
April 2, 1918: The companies concerned merged, and it became a station of the Kyoto Dento electric power company.
April 2, 1918: The companies concerned merged, and it became a station of the Kyoto Dento.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 路線継承により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: March 2, 1942: The tramway was transferred to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and this station became a station of the company.
March 2, 1942: The tramway was transferred to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and this station became a facility of that company.
March 2, 1942: The tramway was transferred to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and this station became a facility of that company.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 嵐電天神川駅 A6 - 蚕ノ社駅 A7 - 太秦広隆寺駅 A8
sen.e: Randen Tenjingawa Station (A6) - Kaikonoyashiro Station (A7) - Uzumasa Koryuji Station (A8)
Randen Tenjingawa Station (A6) - Kaikonoyashiro Station (A7) - Uzumasa Koryuji Station (A8)
Randen-Tenjingawa Station (A6) - Kaikonoyashiro Station (A7) - Uzumasa-Koryuji Station (A8)
sen.cmt: 駅名にハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: 2008年1月16日に開業した京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線の太秦天神川駅は、当駅から東に約250mで、嵐電天神川駅開業までのしばらくの間は当駅が地下鉄との乗換駅の役割を担っていた。
sen.e: Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, which started its operation on January 16, 2008 on the Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway, is located in the approx. 250-m north of this station, and for a while until Randen Tenjingawa Station opened, this station was used to change from a train on subway line to a train on this line or vice versa..

Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, which became operational on January 16, 2008 on the Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway, is located approximately 250 meters north of this station, and for a while until Randen Tenjingawa Station opened, this station was used to change from a train on the subway line to a train on this line or vice versa.

Uzumasa-Tenjingawa Station, which became operational on January 16, 2008 on the Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway, is located approximately 250 meters east of this station, and for a while until Randen-Tenjingawa Station opened, this station was used to change from a train on the subway line to a train on this line or vice versa.
sen.cmt: city →municipal としました。North →east としました。

sen.j: 両駅間は案内表示なども掲示されているものの、当時は歩道が狭く工事中の区間も多かった。
sen.e: Signs informing locations of the two stations were provided, but at the time, the sidewalks were narrow and some construction work was under way in many portions of them.
Signs indicating the locations of the two stations were provided, but at the time the sidewalks were narrow and some construction work was under way in many portions of them.
Signs indicating the locations of the two stations were provided, but at the time the sidewalks were narrow and some construction work was under way in many portions of them.

sen.j: 同年3月28日に当駅から山ノ内駅 (京都府)寄りの約280m東側に嵐電天神川駅が開業したため、そちらが乗換駅となった。
sen.e: On March 28, 2008, Randen Tenjingawa Station, placed in the apprx. 280-m east of this station, on the Yamanouchi Station (locatied in Kyoto Prefecture) side, started its operation, and the new station became to be used as a station where passengers on a train on one of the two lines change their train to one on the other line.

On March 28, 2008, Randen Tenjingawa Station, located approximately 280 meters east of this station, on the Yamanouchi Station (located in Kyoto Prefecture) side, went into operation, and the new station came to be used as a station where train passengers on one of the two lines would change to a train on the other line.

On March 28, 2008, Randen-Tenjingawa Station, located approximately 280 meters east of this station, on the Yamanouchi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) side, went into operation, and the new station came to be used as a station where train passengers on one of the two lines would change to a train on the other line.
sen.cmt: 駅名にハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: 詳しくは、嵐電天神川駅の項を参照のこと。
sen.e: For more informatio, refer to Randen Tenjingawa Station.
For more informatio, refer to Randen Tenjingawa Station.
For more information, refer to Randen-Tenjingawa Station.
sen.cmt: 駅名にハイフンを追加しました。スペルを修正しました。
